column2: [DEPRECATED] Realtime server push with node.js, WebSockets and Comet

column5:
Merge pull request #113 from dinjas/master

Updated socket.io dependency to use the latest (0.8.7) version.
Missed a few references to socket.io version in my first pass.
Updated socket.io dependency to use the latest (0.8.7) version. This resolved an issue with Mac Chrome 16 + websockets for me.

Merge pull request #111 from jskulski/update-sync

Node 0.6+ uses 'util' instead of 'sys'

Merge pull request #99 from RKelln/patch-1

Use absolute paths for SSL keys. Check that both exist.
Use absolute paths for SSL keys. Check that both exist.

Merge pull request #97 from raid5/master

Add Juggernaut js object to window so it is accessible when using the Rails 3.1 asset pipeline
Add Juggernaut js object to window so it is accessible when using the Rails 3.1 asset pipeline.
fix :except option for latest Socket IO

Merge pull request #96 from duncanbeevers/asset_pipeline

Expose Juggernaut gem to Rails asset pipeline

Expose Juggernaut gem to Rails asset pipeline

All client-side javascript lives in client/vendor/assets/javascripts.
Generate packaged application.js by leveraging sprockets gem directly.

Merge pull request #78 from robinator/master

The RedisToGo fix was only accounting for heroku namespaces.
fix subscribe, was using the old redis_options variable
allow you to send options to SocketIO
allow you to send options to SocketIO
more heroku fixes - easily use redistogo url, use port 80 by default
fix unsubscribe callbacks piling up (thanks gorman)

Merged pull request #61 from exploid/patch-1.

Fix typo in title
use a custom version of node-static
prevent redis quitting when it encounters errors
update readme with references to npm and brew
remove submodules, package with npm, remove jutils and cleanup classes
Merge branch 'redis_replace' of https://github.com/sespindola/juggernaut into sespindola-redis_replace
Make the example app work on https too
Fix subscribe in newer versions of Redis (thanks mikedemers)
Catch all errors - we shouldn't let clients crash the server
we do not need utils (it has been renamed anyhow). Thanks to gipnokote
get rid of requirements - they are vendorized now
remove vendored projects, they should be submodules
do not use customized version of socket.io as the modules are not checked out
Fixed infite loop caused by connecting to two channels straight after each other
Rescue round JSON.parse, so invalid messages can't crash the server

use window.location.hostname rather than window.location.host
host will return port as well, e.g. "localhost:8080". This then gets the port appended
so the browser ends up trying to load localhost:8080:8080
This is the case in Safari, other browsers (e.g. FF) seemed to differ.

Fix two bugs. First is that the unsubscribe event is triggered even if the client isn't subscribed. Second is that that messages weren't being sent to all clients due to the 'len' variable being cached.
Add :except option to Juggernaut, i.e. send it to all clients except a particular session id
Don't call connect twice - causing issues in chrome
add LICENSE. Update README with new installation instructions
get rid of js file ext
compile into one script using sprocketize
